resources.string: Vespucci Pier is located on the western edge of Los Santos in thee middle of Vespucci Beach. It is a very photogenic location with good views of the city and the sea and includes a fairground. Well worth visiting.

Located in the military base, Fort Zancudo, the control tower can be a challenging place to visit due to the base\'s aggressive guards. Visiting it also involves climbing numerous staircases, but it is an interesting location with a number of secret rooms to explore.

Set in the mountains to the south of Paleto Bay, the Altruist Colony seems like an idyllic location until you meet its inhabitants. Once they have been dispatched though, you can explore the numerous buildings, the observation tower and the staircase built in the rock that leads to the communications hut.
Everyone who comes to Los Santos must surely visit Mount Chiliad. The mountain is the highest place on the island providing views across the entire map.
Being the tallest building in Los Santos, The Maze Bank Tower offers exceptional view of the city and an excellent location for photography and base jumping if you are so inclined.
The Observatory represents a peaceful location to view the city calmly away from the chaos of the urban sprawl.
This little know location is a great place to find solitude if needed. There are a number of tunnels to explore and various items you can iteract with.
Throw the darts at the dartboard. This game is called darts. It\'s great.
A relaxing activity with friends. Take a shot at it.
An unusual activity for Los Santos. Worth doing if only once.
A useful activity if you want to improve your shooting stat.
Nobody plays this, but it\'s probably good.
Brutally tedious is the only way to describe this activity.
An old oil drum and a piece of broken palette. What could be more fun?
They apparently show films here, though nobody has ever been know to watch them.
This is the place you go for high-end vehicle customisation; but this can be costly, so make sure you have a healthy bank account before goig to Benny\'s.
An example of one of the low-end clothing stores found throughout Los Santos and Blaine County.
Posonby\'s is the premier clothing store in Los Santos. If you want the best, go to Ponsonby\'s.
The trendy mid-range clothing store of Los Santos.
The classic vehicle customisation garage of Los Santos and beyond.
Located on Vespucci Beach, if you want to look like an animal or a clown, this is the place to go.
If clothing options aren\'t enough for you, decorate yourself from head to foot at your local tattoo parlour.
Though associated with weaponry sales, Ammunation also provides numerous clothing options and a range of accessories found nowhere else.
As you might expect, this is the place to restyle your hair; but makeovers are also available in these locations.
Prices range enormously when it comes to apartments. All have a garage, but the high-end examples include a planning room if you wish to engage in heist missions.
Bunkers offer the chance to make good profits if you\'re prepared to pay the set-up costs, which can be prohibitive.
Clubhouses represent good value for money. They include space for 10 bikes, can be expanded to include a bike mod-shop, offer a range of activities and allow the owner to start up biker businesses.
With a range of prices and seizes, crate warehouses provide a useful way to make a profit.
Expensive though they are, facilities allow the owner to purchase a unique range of vehicles and hst the Doomsday Heists.
From small two-car garages to sixty vehicle office garages, these properties are an essential item for any inhabitant of Los Santos.
If you want to own your own fleet of customised aircraft, a hangar is essential. Locations include L.S. International Airport and Fort Zancudo.
Not expensive to buy, relatively speaking, import/export garages offer probably the most profitable business type in Los Santos.
If you want to be a successful CEO, you need an office. All have a helipad on the roof and can be expanded to include sixty-car garages and accommodation.
Probably the most useless and certainly the most expensive property type, but if you like the water, go ahead.
With its stealth ability, this helicopter represents one of the safest means of transport in Los Santos.
The Buzzard\'s ability to spawn at your feet if you are a CEO, makes this helicopter a must have.
Though quite understated in appearance, the Nightshark is the toughest vehicle in Los Santos and can take more damage than a tank, three times more in fact; so, well worth the investment.
A fun jet that can outmanoeuvre just about any other plane you might come across.
A great big lumbering beast of a helicopter, the Savage has weaponry that is unrivaled by any other vehicle.
This car double as a submarine, James Bond style. It can take care of numerous threats with its guided missiles and offers a great means of transport in a dangerous city.
an image of the customisation location
an icon indicating the customisation type
an icon indicating a link to the map
an image of the property type
